author: Special Correspondent
text:
Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif’s Adviser on Foreign Affairs, Sartaj Aziz, in a TV interview to Indian journalist Karan Thapar on Monday, announced that Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) chief Masood Azhar is in custody.

According to Mr. Aziz, one of the mobile numbers called by the terrorists involved in the Pathankot airbase attack led investigators to the JeM headquarters, which is also the first time this has been divulged by Pakistan officially. He said the SIT team from Pakistan had received permission “in principle” to travel to India, and he expected the team to be in India in the next two weeks (End February or early March).

On February 18, however, MEA spokesperson Vikas Swarup had denied that Pakistan had even sent a formal proposal for the team that is expected to comprise ISI and Military Intelligence and investigation officials.

“We have said that we welcomed the decision of the Pakistan government to form an SIT. As and when a firm proposal is received, then the modalities will be worked out,” he said.
title: Pathankot attackers called JeM headquarters: Aziz
